conversations.content: SUMMER!
BEACH!
VACATIOOON!
Now, now, everyone. Settle down.
Ha ha... Let them have their fun. The whole point of summer break is to cut loose a bit.
I suppose there's some sense to that.  Everyone HAS been working hard of late.
Exactly. That's why I hope we can all enjoy this little getaway to the fullest!
This guy gets it! This season is for one thing and one thing only: doing as little as humanly possible.
Mitsuhide has the right of it. Summer break is for—wait. What?
MITSUHIDE?!
Um, yeah? Hi? Why's everybody so surprised?
Any sensible person would be! What are you doing here? And how long have you been amongst us?
A couple minutes, tops. I only just now managed to catch up.
A little birdie told me you folks were hitting the beach, so I came all the way from Hinomoto to join in the fun!
I... I see. And your purpose here is...?
Uhhh, to enjoy the sun, surf, and sand?
I ask this strictly for confirmation, but... You've a role of some importance in Hinomoto, do you not?
Yeah, I guess? I'm one of the twelve Wyrmclan leaders, at least officially.
Yes, ＂officially＂ in the sense that you are literally, in point of fact, one of the twelve Wyrmclan leaders! *sigh* In any case...
I've heard Hinomoto is suffering through an uncommonly hot summer this year. Is this truly the time for leisure travel?
Yeaaah, about that... I told my people I was stepping out for a while. They can handle things while I'm gone. Probably.
All jokes aside, I genuinely needed a break. Lately it's been nothing but work, work, work, day in and day out.
So I came all this way to spend my precious summer break with you folks: my dear friends.
Well, it's certainly true that the Wyrmclan leaders always seem to have their hands full.
And seeing as I just finished extolling the merits of the occasional respite from work, I think it only fair I invite you to join ours!
I knew I liked you.
Now that that's settled, I look forward to having you all as attendan—er, beach buddies! Ahhh, the fun we'll have together.
...Why did nobody warn me?
The hateful sun! The murderous heat! Are Alberian summers always this miserable?
It's not usually quite this bad. Seems this summer is a scorcher everywhere.
Whaaat? I came all the way from Hinomoto to get AWAY from it all.
Heeey! Guys!
What is it, Luca?
We're splitting open a watermelon blindfolded over there. Fancy a whack?
Ooh, that sounds like fun. Mitsuhide?
Hmmm... I do enjoy watermelon, but that sounds suspiciously like physical labor. You're really doing that in this heat?
Well, yeah! What screams summer more than bashing open a gourd with a two-by- four while the sun turns you extra-crispy?
...Do you have brain worms or something?
Ah! There you all are!
Oh, hey, Patia. What's up?
Estelle and I are putting together a beach volleyball game after this, and we're looking for members. Care to join?
Exercising, on a day like this? On purpose? I'm dizzy just hearing it.
Oh, come on! What could be better volleyball weather than a nice, clear day like today? It's perfect out!
Not the word I would choose to describe an attempted homicide on the sun's part, but you do you...
A-HA! So this is where you've been hiding.
And now it's Celliera. How can we help you, armsmaster?
I'm so glad you asked! What do you say... to holding an intensive training camp?!
Training...camp?
Exactly! I'm happy to set everything up. You'll leave with more information in your noggin than you ever wanted or needed!
Picture this: bodies sweating together on the hot sand, pushing each other that extra mile... You'll glisten like the summer sun!
And at the end of it all, I'll give your poor, abused muscles the hands-on help of a seasoned instructor. What do you say?!
Is this the part where I make an open show of how appalled I am?
Yup. Sorry, Celliera, but I'm with Ms. Mousy on this one.
Training camp gets a hard pass from me! Now, if you'll excuse me, there's a melon with my name on it. Coming, Mitsuhide?
Uhhh, I don't really—
Whoa, hey, hold on! We need people for volleyball or none of us can play.
Please, Mitsuhide?! You have to team up with me to take down Estelle and Amane!
Look, I definitely never agreed to—
What are you saying, Patia?! And you call yourself a knight?
Training doesn't go on summer vacation, and neither should anyone who hopes to defend the people!
You tell her, Mitsuhide! Then we can get cracking on this training camp.
I can tell her that you're quite insane...
It's not summer without watermelon!
You mean it's not summer without VOLLEYBALL!
Training camp! Training camp! TRAINING CAMP!!!
All right, everyone, let's not fight! Why don't you all take a deep breath?
Ugh... How do they have the energy to be so annoying in this HEAT?
Hmmm. Actually... HEY! ALL OF YOU!
You lot have been going on and on about doing the sweatiest things possible in the sweatiest weather imaginable.
You've been driven mad, every one of you. By a villain in seasonal clothing!
Uh... Come again?
You heard me. ＂Oh, wow, it's summer!＂ ＂Oh, look, it's the beach!＂ ＂Oh, gee, there's not a cloud in the sky! I LOVE sunburns!＂
This hateful season has you all wrapped around its little finger. It's controlling you!
What you're doing isn't enjoying summer; it's being a slave to it. You must instead turn the tables and seize control!
And...how exactly does one do that?
Simple: we break summer. Bring it to its knees. And then we take the reins into our own hands.
We stage an uprising—an all-out rebellion against this season of unsightly backsweat!
A rebellion against SUMMER?!
Exactly. No longer will it stand laughing over our broken bodies in sticky swimsuits!
The enemy is the summer heat!
*yaaawn* Good morning, Cleo. Looks like we're in for another scorcher.
Good morning, Euden. Heh... It's unlike you to have slept in so late.
Have I? My apologies. I didn't realize the time. Is everyone else already awake?
Save Mitsuhide, yes.
Well, at least I rose before HER. Ha ha. Though I'm still curious what she meant yesterday about rebelling against summer.
I heard about that. Very curious.
I have no idea what she's planning. She went to bed last night saying her uprising ＂begins on the morrow.＂ *shrug*
Sleeping past noon makes for a poor opening salvo, I should think. I suppose I'll go check on her.
Oh, Mitsuhiiide? Time to rise and shi—
Hm? She's not in bed. Mitsuhide...?
Eep!
Ouch. I just stubbed my toe on that... That, uh...
EEEEEEEEEK!!!
That was Cleo's voice!
Cleo! Are you all right?!
Everyone... I... Th-there... In the storage compartment under the flooring...
What is it? What's in... WAUGH?!
There's a person stuffed inside! Are those Mitsuhide's feet sticking out?!
HEY! Mitsuhide, say somethin'!
Gal's gone cold...
Are you serious?! C'mon, Mitsuhide! Wake up! Rrgh... Who did this to you?!
Could she have been targeted by an assassin? Some enemy of the Wyrmclan leaders?
No... This cannot be...
...Huh?
Nnnrgh... It's too HOT! ...Muh?
Oh. Morning. ...What? Why do all of you look like you saw a ghost?
Why...
For the love of everything holy...
WERE YOU SLEEPING IN THERE?!
Ugh, what's got you lot so cranky? I just woke up. Stop screaming in my ear.
The heat had me tossing and turning all night. I thought it might be cooler under the floorboards, so I crawled in to find out.
Turns out I'm a GENIUS, because it's super nice down there! Almost chilly, even.
I mean, what a find! So, lovely as it is to see you all, I've got a climate-controlled burrow to get back to. Call me in a few hours? Actually, don't. I'll call you.
Enough! My heart can't take any more!
Unbelievable. She actually crammed HERSELF down there.
Don't you need to wake up and start your day by now, Mitsuhide?!
Nah.
I very much beg to differ! And what of the revolution?! Where has all your talk of striking back at summer gone?
Hasn't gone anywhere. I'm in the heat of battle right now.
This is what ＂battle＂ looks like to you?
Ugh... Let me put this in simpler terms for you: summer hot. Me no like hot.
And?
You're lovely people, but you really aren't the sharpest. Look. It's hot. I aim to spend the season as cool and inert as possible.
THAT is how you strike back at summer.
So, if you'll excuse me, I'm going to get back to my radical, revolutionary, chilly, lazy nap. Buh-bye, now.
Willful inertia as a radical act of defiance against the summer heat...
(How is that any different from what she normally does?)
Phew. That's another long shift in the bag. Helping out at the Kitty Cafe is tough work.
And I'm exhausted after a full day of exercise. When's dinner?
Hey, you two. Heading back now?
Hello, Mitsuhide. It's rare to see you gracing the beach with your presence.
Heh heh heh. My sworn enemy, the sun, has retreated beyond the horizon line.
I'm just enjoying a little victory lap. From now till dawn is MY time.
It's only under veil of night when the REAL fun begins. Either of you care to partake?
Come again?
Your confusion belies your curiosity! Just follow me, ladies. Heh heh heh...
It was then the ghost at the front door whispered...
＂The ones who died...were all of you inside the room!＂
EEEEEEEK!
Holy smokes... That one hit different, huh, Luca? I got chills all up 'n down my body!
Yeah... Me too. You'd think it was the dead of winter with the way my teeth're chattering!
Erm... Mitsuhide? What are we... What is this?
The Great Summer Cool-Off Ghoul-Off. It's custom in Hinomoto to beat the heat on summer nights by telling spooky stories.
Whatcha think? Hard to feel hot when cold sweat is dripping down your back, right?
It's...not really doing much for me. I'm a little old to still believe in these sorts of things. Right, Amane?
Amane? Are... Are you shivering?
BWAH! N-n-n-no! I'm a grown lady. Such silly tales are for children; I would never—
BOO!
NWAAAAAUGH?!
Aha ha ha! You're terrified! Oh, that's adorable.
MITSUHIDE! I shall thank you not to tease me! Children should show their elders respect.
What?! I'm no child! If anyone here's still a kid, it's YOU, Amane.
In what POSSIBLE way am I a child?! I've been a fully grown adult for ages!
Now, now. You little gals should be sticking together, not—
WE'RE NOT LITTLE!!!
Pfft... Aha ha ha ha ha! Ohhh, this is too fun. This ＂veil of night＂ stuff rules.
Glad I could help you see the light. Er, the lack thereof? Anyway, a very wise, very important Hinomotoan once said that summer is all about the nights!
It's cooler and more comfortable than the daytime, and there's no end to the fun stuff you can do.
Huh... Now that you mention it, it IS quite comfortable, compared to this afternoon.
Perhaps I should get my jog in before the sun rises. I could probably cover considerably more distance.
Sounds a lot more efficient than doing it in the sweltering heat and needing to catch your breath every five minutes.
When the hateful sun vacates the sky, that's our time to do whatever we please.
All just another front in our rebellion against summer.
Ah, I get it! So living it up at night was all part of your master plan.
Havin' fun AND dodgin' the heat... Maybe this rebellion thing ain't crazy after all.
Finally catching on, are we? Now, what do you say we head down to the shore with these?
Ooh, aren't those the handheld pyroblossoms Su Fang was working on?
Nice! I bet pyroblossoms are even prettier at night!
Then it's decided. All units, forward march! What's our rallying cry?!
SUN'S OUT, FUN'S OUT! NIGHT TIME, RIGHT TIME!
*siiiiiiiiigh*
I-is everything all right, Cleo? You sound rather upset.
Good morning, Euden. I'm glad to see you're awake. ...That makes two of us.
Only two?
Mitsuhide has been spreading her anti- daytime gospel, and now everyone's gone completely nocturnal.
I will admit that sleeping by day and waking at night lets you avoid the sun, but...
Buuut now everyone's taken to snoozing till the day's half-gone.
*sigh* They're all free to wage their little revolution, and sleeping in while on vacation isn't a crime...
But I do wish they'd consider the person in charge of making breakfast.
Starting tomorrow, anyone out of bed after mid-morning can just wait until lunch!
Ahhh... This tiny pool is heaven. Swimming in the shade is glorious.
Squeeeak!
Hm? What's that?
Squeak! Squa-squeak!
One of the mice was...caught by a hawk? But if he struggles TOO hard while it's over open water, he'll—
Squeak! Squa?! SQUEEEEEEEAK?!
Squee-squeak!
Oh, I knew that was going to happen!
(Falling into the drink that far out from shore... There's no way he's beating the current all the way back to the beach.)
*sigh* Fine. I suppose I'll come to the rescue. I don't have a boat, so this kiddy pool will have to do.
Anchors... *grunt* ...aweigh.
*huff* *huff* You okay, bud? Oh, stop splashing around already. I've got you.
Squee-squa-squeeeak!
Phew. There, you're fine. Just don't go getting scooped up by any more birds, all right?
Squeak!
There's a good lad. Now we just have to get back to shore. Which...
(Gah. Of course we're caught in the current. It's hardly a surprise, but it's stronger than I expected.)
(Aaand it's flowing the exact opposite direction from land. Just my luck.)
Ugh... And I was making such progress on today's lounging. How did it come to this?
Lunch time, everyone! Come and eat!
Hold up, Cleo. Mitsuhide's not back. She's the only one missing.
Oh, dear. Where did she go?
Hm... Out of all of us, I should think her the LEAST likely to get so caught up in something she'd miss a meal.
Gahhh... So...hot...
Squeak...?
Oh, calm down. We have a simple enough way back to shore. Daikokuten? You're up.
It'd be my pleasure! My wings shall deliver us back to dry land in two shakes of a mouse's tail!
Squeee!
One, two... One...two... Oh, it's hot... Mercy ME, it's hot...
Oh...dear...
My apologies, Mitsuhide. My robes are the height of elegance, but elegance is little use against such intemperate weather...
I am...defeated... Gwarg!
Wha—?! Hey, WHOA! *glub* *blubble*
*GASP!* Ugh, I... *cough* I thought I was done for.
Squee... Squeeeak...
You all right? Ugh. What was Daikokuten thinking, wearing all that in the middle of summer?
(Well, no sense worrying about that now. Things are starting to look a bit dire.)
(No boat, no dragon, no plan...)
It's really...truly...hot beyond measure.
Just BREATHING in this heat is exhausting. My brain isn't working at all...
I seriously...hate the summer...
Mm?
Rain... An evening squall?
It feels so nice. The raindrops are lukewarm against my...skin...
Mi...de...
Mitsu...de...
MITSUHIDE!
Ngh?!
Oh, thank goodness! You're awake.
Huh? But I was...out at sea...
Squeak! Squa-squeak!
Oh... You're alive. Then, were we...?
Wait. Don't answer that. The fact that I'm alive says it all.
Yes, though only just. If not for the rain, I fear the heat might have done you in.
So the weather...saved our lives? Aha ha...ha ha ha.
(I've been warring against the hateful summer weather, and here it has the nerve to come along and save my life.)
(Summer is hot and obnoxious and capricious to boot. I feel toyed with.)
It's all rather infuriating. Like I'm caught up in the whims of a fate I can't control.
Hm? I didn't catch that, Mitsuhide.
Forget it. I'm just sitting here fuming about the summer weather playing tricks on me.
There's not much of the season left, but you had better believe I'll be escalating my war against it after this.
*sigh* Our beach trip had its ups and downs, but now that we're home, there's a sad sense of finality about it all.
I still haven't quite managed to shake my mind out of vacation mode.
I'm quite the same. I may have let myself relax a bit TOO much over the break.
We shall have to redouble our efforts to get back to norm—uh? Hello?
Ahhh, I feel so cool—so free! This is heaven!
Why...are you wearing your swimsuit inside the castle?
Here we're fretting over still being in vacation mode, and this one's yet to even entertain the notion it's over.
Try to contain your jealousy. We may be back from the beach, but as long as it stays this hot out, I'm staying on break.
A rebellion isn't over until the war is won.
I... I see.
Lady Mitsuhiiideee!
Oh, I recognize that voice.
*huff* *huff* Phew! I finally made it to Alberia!
Sorry, milady, but the jig is up. Your life as a fugitive hiding abroad ends today!
Pardon? I distinctly recall her asserting that her vacation time had been cleared through the appropriate channels.
Yeah, no. I'm afraid she conned you, sir! Lady Mitsuhide snuck out of her office mid-workday and ran for the hills!
What?!
Stop making it sound like I'm the villain here. I DID give word that I'd be taking some time off...to Bonnie.
Telling your mouse doesn't get the message to the rest of us, milady!
Thanks to your disappearance, work has been piling up left and right. The masses wound up swarming my office!
You mean there have been RIOTS as a result? I pray none of you were harmed!
No, we're all fine, thank you. Everyone was SUPER angry at first, so I was worried it might turn into a full-blown incident...
But one look at my adorable face, and everyone calmed right down! Tee hee. ☆
That's...a feat of diplomacy only you could pull off, Chitose.
You flatter me, sir. ☆ But just because no one got hurt doesn't make it all right!
We're going to light a fire under your tush until you've worked hard enough to make it up to all the citizens you let down!
...Let me ask you something, Chitose.
In agriculture, construction, and industry, did we lose more productivity than any other region while I was away?
What? Oh, absolutely. Productivity is way down across the board. Just look at—
Huh? That's strange... If we're comparing it to the other regions, we haven't really lost any more ground than anyone else.
Mm-hm. And the medical directors? What do they have to say?
Well... The doctors all seemed pretty happy, actually?
They said that we've lost very few people to heat, given how bad the summer's been. And that other regions have seen worse...
There you have it. What have I said this whole time? Push yourself to work in this heat, and you'll just wind up sick.
Which is why I ordered our people to sleep the summer away, one and all. But nooo, when the weather's nice, people want to DO things.
I figured if they're all going to ignore me and do whatever they please, I may as well do the same! And so I left.
So you came to Alberia in order to FORCE yourself—and by extension, your people— to take it easy during this heat wave.
Incidentally, WE'VE all managed to avoid succumbing to any heat-related illness this summer as well.
I suppose we have. In years past, I often got lightheaded from staying out in the sun for too long.
And I've been sunburned more times than I can count. Yet this year, I spent my time in the shade instead.
I've always felt a lethargy in the late summer weeks, myself, but I've been completely fine this year.
All despite temperatures being hotter than ever. Hm... Was it truly because we all kept to the shade with Mitsuhide?
You're welcome. The whole reason summer breaks started in the first place was to escape the heat, after all.
Mitsuhide... Don't tell me that all that talk of rebellion against summer and dragging us into your pageant of indolence was—
Actually a deliberate plan to preserve our health and that of her people?!
Hm, I wonder! What I WILL say is that if this little episode has made any of you converts to easy living, you're welcome.
I... I suppose it has! I cannot deny that you have taught me how to stay cool during the summer months.
And I'll make an effort in years to come to laze about just enough to avoid that usual bout of lethargy.
As will I. Thank you, Mitsuhide!
Hah hah haaah! No problemo, my chums. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm overdue for today's post-midday powernap pre-nap.
Gosh... I had no idea Lady Mitsuhide was doing it all for her people and her friends the entire time.
I know I'VE been working hard all summer. Maybe I should spend some time goofing off in this nice, cool castle... Ack! NO!
That is NOT why I came all the way here!
Lady Mitsuhideee! You're coming back with me to Hinomoto TODAY!
Ugh, weren't you listening? We all just decided that—GAH! Let GO of me!
Lemme go, lemme go, LEMME GOOOOO!
That was...perhaps not the most dignified farewell.
Anyway, one cannot deny that by resisting summer's temptations and staying cool, we all managed to preserve our health.
In that regard, we may have truly taken the reins from summer, thanks to Mitsuhide's intervention.
Ha ha. I suppose that makes her rebellion an unqualified success. ＂Night time, right time,＂ indeed!
